Description:
Position Overview:The Transport In-Charge is responsible for overseeing the transportation operations of an organization. This role involves managing a fleet of vehicles, coordinating transportation schedules, ensuring regulatory compliance, and optimizing transportation efficiency to meet the organization's needs.Key Responsibilities:Fleet Management:Supervise and manage a fleet of vehicles, including maintenance, repairs, and regular inspections.
Ensure vehicles are clean, properly maintained, and equipped for safe transportation.Transportation Planning:Develop transportation schedules and routes to ensure timely and efficient delivery of goods, services, or passengers.
Coordinate with various departments to align transportation activities with organizational goals.Driver Management:Hire, train, and supervise drivers, ensuring they adhere to safety protocols, regulations, and customer service standards.
Monitor driver performance and provide feedback for improvement.Regulatory Compliance:Stay updated on local, state, and federal transportation regulations, ensuring compliance with all relevant laws and requirements.
Obtain necessary permits and licenses for vehicles and drivers.
Renewal of Vehicle permits & vehicle insuranceSafety and Security:Implement safety protocols and guidelines for drivers and vehicles, promoting safe driving practices and accident prevention.
Conduct regular safety training and awareness programs for drivers.Vehicle Maintenance:Coordinate regular maintenance and repairs for vehicles, ensuring they are in optimal operating condition.
Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, inspections, and repairs.
 Cost Management:
Monitor and manage transportation-related expenses, including fuel, maintenance, repairs, and driver salaries.
Identify cost-saving opportunities while maintaining service quality.Communication and Reporting:Maintain effective communication with drivers, colleagues, and other stakeholders to ensure smooth transportation operations.
Generate and analyze transportation performance reports, identifying trends and areas for improvement.Skills
Skills:
High school diploma or equivalent; relevant certifications or degrees are a plus.
Proven experience in transportation management or a related role.
Strong knowledge of transportation regulations, safety standards, and logistics.
Leadership and team management skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.
Proficiency in using transportation management software and technology.
Analytical skills to evaluate transportation data and optimize operations.
Problem-solving and decision-making capabilities.
Attention to detail and organizational skills.
Ability to work under pressure and adapt to changing situations.
